tit.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルに合せて表記を訂正しました。

sen.j: 市庭古墳（いちにわこふん）は、奈良県奈良市佐紀町塚本・市庭にある古墳。
sen.e: Ichiniwa Kofun (市庭古墳) is a tumulus, or a megalithic tomb which lies across Tsukamoto and Ichiniwa, Saki-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Ichiniwa Tumulus is a megalithic tomb which lies across Tsukamoto and Ichiniwa, Saki-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルに合せて表記を訂正しました。
sen.e: Ichiniwa Tumulus is a megalithic tomb which lies across Tsukamoto and Ichiniwa, Saki-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 佐紀盾列古墳群の東群に属し、その中でも西端に位置する。
sen.e: It belongs to the east group of the Sakitatenami burial mounds, and is located at the western end of the group.
It belongs to the east group of the Sakitatenami burial mounds, and is located at the western end of the group.
It belongs to the east group of the Sakitatenami burial mounds, and is located at the western end of the group.

sen.j: 前方後円墳であるが前方部は消滅し、現在残っているのは後円部の一部のみである。
sen.e: Although it is a zenpo-koen-fun(前方後円墳, large keyhole-shaped tomb mound), its front square part has disappeared, and only a part of its rear round part remains now.
Although it is a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, its front square part has disappeared, and only a part of its rear round part remains now.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Although it is a large keyhole-shaped tomb mound, its front square part has disappeared, and only a part of its rear round part remains now.
File of Ichiniwa Kofun - 1
File of Ichiniwa Tumulus - 1
sen.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルに合せて表記を訂正しました。
sen.e: File of Ichiniwa Tumulus - 1

sen.j: 平城宮大極殿跡のすぐ北に隣接しており、かつては直径100メートル超の最大級の円墳と思われていた。
sen.e: Ichiniwa Kofun is immediately adjacent to the north of the traces of Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) in Heijo-kyu Palace, and it was once thought to have been one of the largest en-fun (円墳, circular tomb mound) whose diameter was over 100 meters.

Ichiniwa Tumulus is immediately adjacent to the north of the traces of Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) in Heijo-kyu Palace, and it was once thought to have been one of the largest circular tomb mound whose diameter was over 100 meters.
sen.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルに合せて表記を訂正しました。漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。
sen.e: Ichiniwa Tumulus is immediately adjacent to the north of the traces of Daigokuden (Council Hall in the Imperial Palace) in Heijo-kyu Palace, and it was once thought to have been one of the largest circular tomb mound whose diameter was over 100 meters.

sen.j: しかしその後の発掘調査で前方部が平城宮建設のさいに削平されており、本来は墳丘の全長253メートル 前方部の幅164メートル 後円部の直径147メートルの前方部を南に向けた前方後円墳であることが判明した。
sen.e: But the later excavation and research has revealed that its front square part had been removed and leveled out when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed, and that the original tumulus had been a zenpo-koen-fun with its front square part facing south, whose total length was 253 meters with its front square part being 164 meters in width and its rear round part being 147 meters in diameter.

But the later excavation and research has revealed that its front square part had been removed and leveled out when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed, and that the original tumulus had been a keyhole-shaped tomb mound with its front square part facing south, whose total length was 253 meters with its front square part being 164 meters in width and its rear round part being 147 meters in diameter.
sen.cmt: 前文の表記に合せて、keyhole-shaped tomb moundに訂正しました。
sen.e: But the later excavation and research has revealed that its front square part had been removed and leveled out when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed, and that the original tumulus had been a keyhole-shaped tomb mound with its front square part facing south, whose total length was 253 meters with its front square part being 164 meters in width and its rear round part being 147 meters in diameter.

sen.j: 葺石、くびれ部分両側の造り出し、二重濠の一部分なども確認されている。
sen.e: What is more, fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb), tsukuridashi (narrow terraces) at the both sides of the central narrow part, and a part of the double moats have also been distinguished.
What is more, fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb), tsukuridashi (narrow terraces) at the both sides of the central narrow part, and a part of the double moats have also been distinguished.
What is more, fuki-ishi (stones covering an old tomb), tsukuridashi (narrow terraces) at the both sides of the central narrow part, and a part of the double moats have also been distinguished.

sen.j: 同古墳と同様に平城宮建設の際に破壊された古墳としては、第2次大極殿跡の下に位置する神明野古墳（全長117m）がある。
sen.e: Another kofun that had been destroyed like Ichiniwa Kofun when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed is Shimeno Kofun (神明野古墳) (117 m in total length) which had been located below the second Daigokuden site.
Another kofun that had been destroyed like Ichiniwa Kofun when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed is Shimeno Tumulus (117m in total length) which had been located below the second Daigokuden site.
sen.cmt: 漢字は削除しました。Tumulusに訂正しました。スペース削除しました。
sen.e: Another kofun that had been destroyed like Ichiniwa Kofun when Heijo-kyu Palace was constructed is Shimeno Tumulus (117m in total length) which had been located below the second Daigokuden site.

sen.j: 後円部の中心部分は宮内庁により平城天皇楊梅陵に指定されている。
sen.e: The central part of the rear round part of Ichiniwa Kofun has been designated as Emperor Heizei's Yamamomo no Misasagi (平城天皇楊梅陵) by the Imperial Household Agency.
The central part of the rear round part of Ichiniwa Tumulus has been designated as Emperor Heizei's Yamamomo no Misasagi by the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: Tumulusに訂正しました。漢字は削除しました。
sen.e: The central part of the rear round part of Ichiniwa Tumulus has been designated as Emperor Heizei's Yamamomo no Misasagi by the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 円筒埴輪、動物埴輪などが出土している。
sen.e: Ento haniwa (cylindrical clay figures) and dobutsu haniwa (animal-shaped clay figures) have been unearthed.
Ento haniwa (cylindrical clay figures) and dobutsu haniwa (animal-shaped clay figures) have been unearthed.
Ento haniwa (cylindrical clay figures) and dobutsu haniwa (animal-shaped clay figures) have been unearthed.

sen.j: 築造時期は古墳時代中期前半（5世紀前半）と見られている。
sen.e: Consequently, it is thought that this tumulus was constructed in the first half of the mid Kofun period (the first half of the fifth century).
Consequently, it is thought that this tumulus was constructed in the first half of the mid Kofun period (the first half of the fifth century).
Consequently, it is thought that this tumulus was constructed in the first half of the mid Kofun period (the first half of the fifth century).

sen.j: 平城京の建設以前から存在した市庭古墳が、平安時代の人物である平城天皇のために造られた古墳でないことは明らかで陵墓の治定に否定的な意見が多い。
sen.e: Because it is clear that Ichiniwa Kofun which had existed since before the construction of Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) is not a tomb mound made for Emperor Heizei who was a person in the Heian period, there are many negative opinions on the authorization of the imperial mausolea.

Because it is clear that Ichiniwa Tumulus which had existed since before the construction of Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) is not a tomb mound made for Emperor Heizei who was a person in the Heian period, there are many negative opinions on the authorization of the imperial mausolea.

Because it is clear that Ichiniwa Tumulus which had existed since before the construction of Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) is not a tomb mound made for Emperor Heizei who was a person in the Heian period, there are many negative opinions on the authorization of the imperial mausolea.

sen.j: 現在の治定が正しいとするなら、平城天皇には新たな陵墓が造られず既存の古墳に追墓されたことになる。
sen.e: If the authorization is right, it means that a new imperial mausoleum was not made for Emperor Heizei, but he was buried in an existing kofun as the additional deceased.
If the authorization is right, it means that a new imperial mausoleum was not made for Emperor Heizei, but he was buried in an existing kofun as the additional deceased.
If the authorization is right, it means that a new imperial mausoleum was not made for Emperor Heizei, but he was buried in an existing kofun as the additional deceased.
